user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_send_init_static_vars_:
```c
void
MHD_send_init_static_vars_ (void)
{
#ifdef HAVE_FREEBSD_SENDFILE
  /* FreeBSD 11 and later allow to specify read-ahead size
   * and handles SF_NODISKIO differently.
   * SF_FLAGS defined only on FreeBSD 11 and later. */
#ifdef SF_FLAGS
  freebsd_sendfile_init_ ();
#endif /* SF_FLAGS */
#endif /* HAVE_FREEBSD_SENDFILE */
#if defined(HAVE_SYSCONF) && defined(_SC_IOV_MAX)
  iov_max_init_ ();
#endif /* HAVE_SYSCONF && _SC_IOV_MAX */
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_send_init_static_vars_:
static void
iov_max_init_ (void)
{
  long res = sysconf (_SC_IOV_MAX);
  if (res >= 0)
    mhd_iov_max_ = (unsigned long) res;
  else
  {
#if defined(IOV_MAX)
    mhd_iov_max_ = IOV_MAX;
#else  /* ! IOV_MAX */
    mhd_iov_max_ = 8; /* Should be the safe limit */
#endif /* ! IOV_MAX */
  }
}
...
#define HAVE_SYSCONF 1
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No direct use of memcmp is present in the supplied code. The defined helper iov_max_init_ (provided) uses sysconf and integer operations and does not call memcmp, so it does not need investigation. MHD_send_init_static_vars_ itself contains only conditional calls to platform init routines and no string comparisons. The only fragment that requires further inspection is the call to freebsd_sendfile_init_ (inside the SF_FLAGS conditional) because its implementation is not provided here — it may contain uses of memcmp that compare null-terminated strings and therefore must be checked. No other fragments in the supplied code reference memcmp or perform string comparisons with raw memory comparison functions.
